channel.title: Andrea Cerfoglia's blog
channel.description: Recent content on Andrea Cerfoglia's blog

item.title: Nixie Clock
item.description: As an electronic enthusisast I have always been fascinated with the concept of timekeeping, it’s one of those challenges that humanity has solved. as an example, think about the iconic casio F-91W, it’s cheap (around 20â‚¬) and has been around since forever, still it can realistically keep +-15 sec/month of accuracy in a normal enviroment. as such the day I found my scrapbin some nixie tubes i obviously started thinking about making a tabletop clock.

item.title: About Me
item.description: Hi! im Andrea Cerfoglia, a 22yo currently studying computer engineering at Politecnico Di Milano in Milan, Italy. at the time of this writing I’m in my (hopefully) last year of study and closer than ever to my bachelor degree. I hope to use this blog as a portfolio of my project and ideas as sometimes i create clever things and I would like being able to share them with other thinkers and pheraps even show off too!

item.title: Markdown Syntax Guide
item.description: This article offers a sample of basic Markdown syntax that can be used in Hugo content files, also it shows whether basic HTML elements are decorated with CSS in a Hugo theme.

item.title: Math Typesetting
item.description: Mathematical notation in a Hugo project can be enabled by using third party JavaScript libraries.

item.title: Placeholder Text
item.description: Lorem est tota propiore conpellat pectoribus de pectora summo.

item.title: Rich Content
item.description: Hugo ships with several Built-in Shortcodes for rich content, along with a Privacy Config and a set of Simple Shortcodes that enable static and no-JS versions of various social media embeds.
